column1: Trying to dismantle the ACA and the Coronavirus response team in the same week? All while Americans continue to die from this virus. Trump's been busy but not busy saving lives.  https://t.co/ZSuwMdMliH
Panic-buying guns will not make us safer and risks spreading the Coronavirus further. Thank you @Brady_PAC for promoting this message. #StopCoronavirusGunSurge
In March the Trump Administration listed gun sellers as critical infrastructure during the #COVID19 pandemic. This puts American families more at risk for gun violence.   https://t.co/doxyQVuHIe

The only way we will get through this pandemic is together. Older Americans are significantly more vulnerable to contracting the COVID-19 virus.  Donald Trump continues to spend time playing the victim and mishandling the Coronavirus response. https://t.co/f3DMeaXV8S

The Coronavirus pandemic as highlighted the faults of the Trump Administration in their handling of the pandemic.  American families are sacrificing inside and outside the home to prevent the spread of this terrible disease.  https://t.co/gHmFiTeRsX

More support for small business and expanded testing was long overdue and this bill is a step in the right direction. We are not done and we will not stop until we win the war against the #Coronavirus. #ForThePeople https://t.co/6JD6MjkSNR

On Thursday I joined my @HouseDemocrats colleagues in passing the Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act H.R. 266. This bill provides $484 billion in additional funding to help more Americans affected by the #COVID19 Pandemic.

It is dangerous and irresponsible to suggest injecting yourself with disinfectant to cure the #Coronavirus. I will not stop until we have testing and treatment readily available and accessible to everyone but please don’t experiment with at home solutions.

➡️$310 billion for the Paycheck Protection Program ➡️$75 billion in grants to hospitals around the nation overwhelmed by the Coronavirus pandemic ➡️$60 billion to the SBA for disaster assistance loans and grants ➡️$25 billion to expand Coronavirus testing https://t.co/BLwfWFWNV7

House Democrats are working for the people.  This afternoon the House passed a massive bill to support the small business owners and hospitals of this nation and expand testing for #COVID19. This $480 billion package includes: ⏬⏬⏬
✅Social Distancing  ✅Testing  ✅Contact Tracing  ✅Isolation and Quarantine  ✅Excellent treatment  This is the roadmap we need to take for the next few months in order to win the war against #COVID19.
Fixing the racial disparities that leave black Ohioans more vulnerable to the Coronavirus won’t happen over night.
We cannot truly fight the Coronavirus if we do not acknowledge the racial disparities that leave black communities more vulnerable to contracting #COVID19. We're #InThisTogetherOhio.
The Coronavirus pandemic is an unprecedented situation and it’s normal to not know what to do.

It goes without saying but it doesn’t hurt to reiterate please follow reputable medical advice when dealing with COVID-19.   Please remember to stay safe stay healthy and take care of each other. #InThisTogetherOhio  https://t.co/rOLXf9pOAW

The staff of senior care facilities across the country are going well beyond the call of duty during this pandemic. As we continue to slow and stop the spread of the Coronavirus we must continue to support all of the essential workers including senior care staff.

As we continue to fight the Coronavirus pandemic we see the virus disproportionately impacts black and brown communities. Congressman @joekennedy and I are calling on Congressional leadership to “ban the box” on the Paycheck Protection Program.    https://t.co/pp4WF1JhVJ
The Coronavirus will hit vulnerable individuals and communities much harder.   Be prepared and help stop the spread of #COVID19. We’re #InThisTogetherOhio https://t.co/E49wjLd1el

Thank you to everyone who joined me Minority Leader @EmiliaSykesOH  and @RepMarciaFudge  this afternoon for our tele-town hall to discuss the impact of the Coronavirus on black communities. https://t.co/szsDus6XAJ

The best way to prevent the spread of the Coronavirus is to continue to practice social distancing and wash and sanitize your hands regularly. It's gonna take everyone to move us forward and I am committed to fighting for you. We're #InThisTogetherOhio.

The Coronavirus doesn't care about your race or your class and your healthcare shouldn't either. We cannot make it through this crisis without addressing the inequalities in the healthcare system. https://t.co/wsailaB2nu

The #COVID19 pandemic has highlighted the racial disparities in our healthcare system. This is unacceptable. @MorningEdition discusses why misinformation is especially dangerous for black communities.  https://t.co/dlQ6TJQ9al

Join us this Monday for a telephone town hall with Leader @EmiliaSykesOH and @RepMarciaFudge to discuss the impact of the COVID-19 virus on communities of color. #InThisTogetherOhio https://t.co/N9iokigu2T

The @HHSGov @HUDgov and the @FTA_DOT have announced over $62 million in funding for local community health centers expanding temporary and low-income housing for Central Ohioans and over $50000 to @COTABus to assist them in responding to the coronavirus.
The American Red Cross still needs needs blood donors to prevent shortages and the Coronavirus pandemic has cancelled over 450 blood drives across the state. https://t.co/Xnkbod1TwK

To the nurses and midwives thank you. We are exceedingly grateful for your hard worlk and sacrifice.  Today we celebrate World Health Day and the nurses and midwives who are on the frontlines of this pandemic.  #WorldHealthDay #SupportNursesAndMidwives #COVID19 https://t.co/fLmGX2DVMP

The Board of Commissioners has also approved $250000 for Ohio Hispanic Coalition to provide rent assistance and other emergency services to Spanish-speaking residents disproportionately impacted by COVID-19.  A total of $500000 will go to support Franklin County residents.
The coronavirus will disproportionately affect those the healthcare system continuously leaves out. Make sure your loved ones are protected. https://t.co/hsH1lbUAc8

Delays in diagnosis and treatment can be harmful especially for racial or ethnic minority groups that have higher rates of certain diseases such as diabetes high blood pressure and kidney disease. Those chronic illnesses can lead to more severe cases of COVID-19."

The Coronavirus does not discriminate. This illness has the ability to get anyone sick so it is that much more important that we are all taking the proper precautions to #FlattentheCurve and slow the spread of this disease.

🚨This afternoon the House passed the $2 trillion bipartisan #CARESAct that was passed by the Senate earlier this week. This package is due to be signed into law at 4p. We are all #InThisTogether. We are committed to protecting American families and defeating the coronavirus

Join me for a tele-town hall to discuss the ongoing Coronavirus Pandemic this Friday March 27 2020 at 4:05 PM.  All constituents of Ohio's Third Congressional District are welcome to attend.   https://t.co/Yi5s7xr8qa https://t.co/QDOhY71HnI

In her handling of the #COVID19 response in Ohio @DrAmyActon has kept Ohio at the front of the nation by being proactive in the state's preventative efforts. https://t.co/TE7bPtyrqA

We cannot stress this enough it will take all of us making sacrifices now to protect Ohioans in the future. While it will impact all our lives over the next few weeks it's important that every day we all do everything we can to help prevent the spread of the #COVID19 virus.

#COVID19 Update:  This afternoon during the daily coronavirus conference Governor DeWine announced a statewide hiring freeze in state government outside of those working towards fighting the coronavirus.

This is not only a physical health crisis but one that impacts our financial and mental health. Many Ohioans are feeling the financial strain of the #COVID19 pandemic and if you or a loved one are struggling financially visit the website below. https://t.co/Hui7uFfSrP
The #COVID19 pandemic has been hard on a lot of us.
If you are of the many Ohioans who regularly use mental health resources continue to talk to your mental health providers on continuing regular care during the #COVID19 pandemic.

Rely on news from trusted sources and limit your news intake per day. Ohio Department of Mental Health Director Lori Criss talks below on ways to manage stress and anxiety during the coronavirus pandemic.  https://t.co/WzHteR2NX4
It’s important that you maintain not just your physical but your mental health during the coronavirus pandemic.
A persons reproductive decisions are theirs and theirs alone. These are essential services and should be maintained throughout the #COVID19 pandemic.
Yesterday during his daily #COVID19 press conference @GovMikeDeWine announced that at the end of business Monday March 23rd all senior centers and senior daycare centers will be closed.

If you or a loved one has been affected by the COVID-19 virus and need financial assistance visit the website below for all of the information you need including your most asked questions about filing for unemployment during the coronavirus pandemic.  https://t.co/Hui7uFfSrP
Ohioans have been hit hard by the #COVID19 crisis. On Tuesday alone the state of Ohio received over 29000 unemployment claims.
Yesterday Congresswoman Maxine Waters Chair of the House Financial Services Committee announced plans for the next phase of the House's Coronavirus Response. https://t.co/mLmTcqSJnu

increase funding for production of medical supplies protect financial stability and maintain a transparent market during the pandemic support global economic cooperation and provides a plan to rebuild our economy once we've gotten through the #COVID19 crisis. 3/

The Senate has finally passed the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response bill. This necessary measure will provide paid sick leave expand unemployment insurance and guarantees coronavirus testing for everyone who needs it regardless of insurance status. https://t.co/xyp8ig1IEO
Practicing healthy habits is one way to deal with Coronavirus stress. A balanced diet a good sleep schedule and physical exercise are some simple ways to help reduce stress.

We will continue to keep you up to date on elections information. #COVID19
The court cited in it’s decision that the #COVID19 virus has been of concern since January and Ohioans have been able to vote by mail-in absentee for the last month.

The #FamiliesFirst Response Package includes:  ✅ Paid family sick leave. ✅ Expanded nutritional assistance programs. ✅ Enhanced Unemployment Insurance.   The #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act helps to ensure the safety of American families during this crisis.

In the early hours of this morning the House Democrats were hard at work delivering the Families First Coronavirus Response Package.   The health safety and welfare of the American people must be protected during this national crisis. #FamiliesFirst  https://t.co/rcIpxQCAUh

It’s vital that we put #FamiliesFirst during this pandemic. @HouseDemocrats worked into the early hours of this morning to deliver   ✅ Paid Family Sick Leave ✅ Expanded Nutrition Assistance ✅ Free #COVID19 testing  We got it done because families come first. https://t.co/VlPRGUBw4Y

Congress needs to ensure that hardworking families do not face negative financial consequences to their credit scores assessed banking penalties or face hardship in making home auto student or small business loan payments due to the coronavirus. https://t.co/laUaMXOESn

@HouseDemocrats have continued to put #FamiliesFirst during the #COVID19 response.  Americans need: ✔️#PaidFamilySickLeave ✔️Testing for those who need it. ✔️ Food assistance for vulnerable families and children.

Our #Coronavirus response must be swift and must be complete. Without paid sick leave and assistance to our national food programs millions of families will remain vulnerable. #HealthyFamiliesAct  https://t.co/ioaDRFY0kQ
